pages.text: Calpurnia's Grandfather
Calpurnia's Grandfather
Calpurnia Tate was a young girl who lived in Texas with her family. She was twelve years old.
Calpurnia's grandfather lived with Calpurnia. He was a very smart man.
Calpurnia's grandfather was a naturalist. He liked to learn about nature.
Calpurnia wanted to be a naturalist, too. She wanted to explore nature with her grandfather.
Calpurnia had never talked to her grandfather about being a naturalist. She was nervous.
One day, Calpurnia found the courage to talk to her grandfather. He was happy she wanted to be a naturalist!
Calpurnia's grandfather asked Calpurnia if she wanted to explore the river with him.
Calpurnia was excited to explore the river with her grandfather.
Calpurnia's grandfather handed her a glass jar to catch the insects they found.
Calpurnia and her grandfather walked through a field to get to the river.
Calpurnia's grandfather noticed many things. He saw a bright blue beetle sitting in the grass.
He asked Calpurnia to catch the beetle with the glass jar.
Calpurnia gently caught the blue beetle in the glass jar. She thought it was beautiful.
Calpurnia asked her grandfather if they should keep the beetle. He said they should let it go.
Calpurnia carefully put the beetle on the ground. She watched it crawl away through the grass.
Calpurnia and her grandfather kept walking to the river. Calpurnia learned a lot from him while they walked.
Calpurnia's grandfather told her that she could learn anything by exploring and seeing things for herself.
Calpurnia was excited to learn about nature. She was ready to become a naturalist!
